Or at the very minimum, $1 per emote. Especially if you plan to use them for actual expression, $4 for one or $10 for the bundle... but if you don't want those ones, you're looking at $20 just to fill the 5 slots. It makes no economic sense honestly. Even if you sold them at $1 each, you'd still make a good sizable profit off it!

I'm all for monetization of assets to get value for the time investment, but the only way I'm paying RP for these is if it comes out of a chest and I choose to spend some BE to enchant one. If there were team emotes bundled with the icons, I may shell out for those--but that's it. I would rather mute these altogether and pretend they don't exist than hand over RP for them... especially knowing they've already pushed a loot box system into the game.

This is a complaint, and a long one. Just be warned.
When I first saw the emotes system coming out everyone I knew was against it. "Why is riot trying to make the game more toxic?" Nevertheless I wanted to study the actual impact of emotes in a game, so I watched one, and something blew my mind: empty all chat. There's such a grey area in trash talk. You can't draw any real lines when something goes from friendly banter to personal. This was different. Nothing for the other eight players to read, just a momentary troll picture and probably an eye roll. That's it. That's fine. Actually.... that's great. So i told everyone you guys were genius. Now that they're out... If you went through with this system it's because you found it to be a genuine improvement on all chat. In other words: the game needed it; not wanted it, needed it.Even if I shelled out $20 for a set instead of buying a whole other game with free online capabilities(I have quite a few at this price, so don't pretend there aren't any) it would provide me with zero reassurance to an actual game improvement because my teammates wouldn't have it; my enemies wouldn't have it, and this whole thing could have been an overpriced mute button rework. There are plenty of games that include emotes to improve environment. On top of that champions already have emotes. You could have at least included a base set of emotes and charged for exclusive ones so we can all "Stop dying while typing" if you really believe that's important. But charging five bucks a friggin' emoticon only deserves one response: DX -.- >:(

Looking at the store, the emotes have names. That {{champion:99}} one is "Nice Try", for example. I did **NOT** understand that that was what her face was. 

**Emotes are great to replace typing but** images only can be a vague way of communicating. It would be great if using **emotes also made text appear** with the name of the emote. The text would look like the damage numbers and only appear very briefly above the player.

I do think that only showing the image leaves it open to interpretation, which CAN be great and creative! So ideally, in the emotes menu you would choose which emotes in your wheel would make the text appears.

In the future this could also allow you to make much more specific emotes since you wouldn't be tied down to only communicating something with a character's face.
